chapter.title: Book Series
chapter.para: A book does not have to occur inside something else, but it can, since it can be part of a series. If we want to register that a book belongs to a series, we usually need only note the series title and the location of the book inside the series, i.e. its volume number (if it is numbered).

chapter.para: The different parts are differently coloured: publication, container and location of publication inside container.

Note that the last book has no location in the book series it occurs in - the series may be unnumbered. Note also that the information regarding container and location inside container splits the information regarding the publication in two.

It is not very often that one wishes to catalogue a series on its own, but for reasons of parallelism it is included in the Basic Input Forms. A series has a title, one or more editors, and the series as a whole has a place and time of publication, as well as an extent: the number of volumes published hitherto. We see that one would normally note more pieces information than when cataloguing a book as part of a series. The same holds for periodicals, as we shall see.
